nodes.text: Teach the Controversy is absolute bull****.  The idea that we should be teaching our children all of the ideas and beliefs is not a bad idea if the ideas and beliefs have evidence. What is complete #### is that the backers of Teach the Controversy, namely intelligent design and evangelical Christians go into hissy childish tantrums when you suggest that we actually Teach the Controversy, where by including the origin stories of other religions that are NOT Biblical. Placing the evidence free story of genesis next to the evidence free story of Norse/Egyptian/Pantheon/Native America/Hindu stories enrages the supporters of Teach the Controversy. How can they claim to want to Teach the Controversy when they refuse to accept the teachings of other religions' stories next to their own in a fact like implied setting? Simple: because they don't want to teach the controversy, they just want a back door into science class rooms for biblical creationism.  And these people claim they have morals....

Another pretty important point is that, with respect to evolution there is, uh..., no Controversy to Teach. The Discovery Institute and all the ID/creationist ilk have invented that proposition that the basic ideas of the mechanism of evolution are controversial.
